text: In Go-Back-N protocol let N to be the maximum allowable number of packets that can be transmitted without waiting for an acknowledgment, x to be the sequence number of the oldest unacknowledged packet, and y to be the smallest unused sequence number. The sequence number of in-flight packets falls into: (@) [0, x-1] (b) [x,y - 1] (0 [y, x+N-1] (d) [x,y + N-1]
